speak.voice: So Emma, I've been reading about using patterns to differentiate similar utterances in natural language processing. Can you explain how this works?

Of course. Let's say we have three intents: TurnOnDevice, GetDeviceStatus, and TurnOffDevice. We want to train our model to understand different formats of utterances for each intent.

Exactly. By providing these different formats, the model can learn to recognize the intent regardless of the specific device name mentioned.
And for the GetDeviceStatus intent, we could have an utterance like "Is the DeviceName on?"

Yes, exactly. These variations in the utterances help the model differentiate the intent of turning off a device.
